verse:
कार्यकारणकर्तृत्वे हेतु: प्रकृतिरुच्यते |
पुरुष: सुखदु:खानां भोक्तृत्वे हेतुरुच्यते || 21||
transliteration: kārya-kāraṇa-kartṛitve hetuḥ prakṛitir uchyatepuruṣhaḥ sukha-duḥkhānāṁ bhoktṛitve hetur uchyate
word meanings: kārya—effect; kāraṇa—cause; kartṛitve—in the matter of creation; hetuḥ—the medium; prakṛitiḥ—the material energy; uchyate—is said to be; puruṣhaḥ—the individual soul; sukha-duḥkhānām—of happiness and distress; bhoktṛitve—in experiencing; hetuḥ—is responsible; uchyate—is said to be
translation:
BG 13.21:
                            In the matter of creation, the material energy is responsible for cause and effect; in the matter of experiencing happiness and distress, the individual soul is declared responsible.
commentary: The material energy, with the direction of Brahma, creates myriad elements and forms of life that compose creation.  Brahma makes the master plan and the material energy executes it.  The Vedas state that there are 8.4 million species of life in the material world.  All these bodily forms are transformations of the material energy.  Hence, material nature is responsible for all the cause and effect in the world. The soul gets a bodily form (field of activity) according to its past karmas, and it identifies itself with the body, mind, and intellect.  Thus, it seeks the pleasure of the bodily senses.  When the senses come in contact with the sense objects, the mind experiences a pleasurable sensation.  Since the soul identifies with the mind, it vicariously enjoys that pleasurable sensation.  In this way, the soul perceives the sensations of both pleasure and pain, through the medium of the senses, mind, and intellect.  This can be compared to a dream state:ehi bidhi jaga hari āśhrita rahaī, jadapi asatya deta duḥkha ahaī   (Ramayan)jauṅ sapaneṅ sira kāṭai koī, binu jāgeṅ na dūri dukh hoī   (Ramayan)“The world is sustained by God.  It creates an illusion, which, although unreal, gives misery to the soul.  This is just like if someone’s head gets cut in a dream, the misery will continue until the person wakes up and stops dreaming.”  In this dream state of identifying with the body, the soul experiences pleasure and pain in accordance with its own past and present karmas.  As a result, it is said to be responsible for both kinds of experiences.
new_commentary: The material energy, under the guidance of Brahma, creates various elements and life forms in the universe. According to the Vedas, there are 8.4 million species in the material world, all of which are manifestations of the material energy. Material nature is responsible for the cause and effect in the world. The soul attains a particular body based on its past actions and identifies itself with the body, mind, and intellect. It seeks pleasure through the senses, and when the senses come in contact with their objects, the mind experiences pleasure. The soul perceives these sensations of pleasure and pain through the senses, mind, and intellect, similar to a dream state. Just as a dream brings temporary suffering until one wakes up, the soul experiences pleasure and pain in this illusory identification with the body. Therefore, the soul is responsible for both experiences based on its past and present actions.
newest_commentary: The material energy, guided by Brahma, creates various elements and life forms in the universe. There are 8.4 million species in the material world, all manifestations of this energy. Material nature governs cause and effect. Souls obtain bodies based on past actions and identify with them. Seeking pleasure through the senses, the mind experiences pleasure when senses contact objects. The soul perceives these sensations through the senses, mind, and intellect, akin to a dream state. Like a dream bringing temporary suffering, the soul experiences pleasure and pain in illusory identification with the body. Consequently, the soul is responsible for these experiences based on past and present actions.
